question.name: 2.4.5.6 Odd and even functions (cont)
question.questiontext:
Note that most functions are neither odd nor even; for example \(f(x)=x^3+x^2\) is neither even nor odd.

The reader should confirm (with simple examples) that ‘odd’ and ‘even’ functions have the following properties:

\[\begin{aligned} \text{odd}\ +\ \text{odd} &= \text{odd}\qquad \text{even}\ +\ \text{even} = \text{even}\qquad \text{odd}\ +\ \text{even} = \text{neither}\\ \text{odd}\ \times\ \text{odd} &= \text{even}\qquad \text{even}\ \times\ \text{even}\ =\ \text{even}\qquad \text{odd}\ \times\ \text{even}\ =\ \text{odd}\end{aligned}\]
